stanza.line: Devouring Time blunt thou the lion's (a)paws(/a)
And make the earth devour her own sweet (b)brood(/b)
Pluck the keen teeth from the fierce tiger's (a)jaws(/a)
And burn the long-lived phoenix in her (b)blood(/b)
Make glad and sorry seasons as thou (c)fleet'st(/c)
And do whate'er thou wilt swift-footed (d)Time(/d)
To the wide world and all her fading (c)sweets(/c)
But I forbid thee one most heinous (d)crime(/d)
O carve not with thy hours my love's fair (e)brow(/e)
Nor draw no lines there with thine antique (f)pen(/f)
Him in thy course untainted do (e)allow(/e)
Yet do thy worst old Time despite thy (g)wrong(/g)
My love shall in my verse ever live (g)young(/g)
